formerly: The [[Southlands]] of [[Middle-earth]] | language=[[Westron]] | birth=Late [[Second Age]] | birthlocation=[[Tirharad]] | rule= | death=Devoured by a [[Warg]] under the orders of [[Sauron]] | deathlocation=[[Mordor]] | age= | notablefor= | family= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair=Gray | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Waldreg''' was the barkeeper of [[Tirharad]] during the late [[Second Age]]. Waldreg was invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' by [[Amazon Studios]], where he was portrayed by [[Geoff Morrell]].{{webcite|author=The Lord of the Rings on Prime|articleurl=https://twitter.com/PrimeVideo/status/1559940412114083841|articlename=Get to know the Southlanders in #TheRingsOfPower |dated=17 August 2022|website=[https://twitter.com/ Twitter]|accessed=17 August 2022}} ==History== Waldreg worshipped [[Sauron]] secretly, and wished for his return to [[Middle-earth]]. Under the instruction of [[Adar (The Rings of Power)|Adar]], he activated a mechanism at the [[Watchtower of Ostirith]], which caused a flood of water to flow into the volcano [[Mount Doom|Orodruin]]. As a result, the volcano erupted, destroying the Southlands and effectively creating the land of [[Mordor]].''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'', "[[Udûn (episode)|Udûn]]"''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'', "[[The Eye]]" Waldreg later taunted a captive Sauron, whom he believed to be [[Halbrand]]. After leaving Sauron with a [[Wargs|Warg]], Sauron spoke to the Warg using the [[Black Speech]] and ordered it to kill Waldreg. The old man was later devoured by the Warg. {{References}} [[Category:Men from adaptations]] [[Category:The Rings of Power (TV series) characters]]
